item.title: Sally add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Sally add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Sally add a quote by Blaise Pascal
item.description: "By space the universe encompasses me and swallows me up like an atom; by thought I comprehend the world." -- Blaise Pascal

item.title: Sally add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Sally add a quote by Jackson Browne
item.description: "Don't confront me with my failures, I had not forgotten them." -- Jackson Browne

item.title: Sally add a quote by John McGill
item.description: "Today is the first day of the rest of your existential crisis." -- John McGill

item.title: Sally add a quote by Heinrich Heine
item.description: "Where they have burned books, they will end in burning human beings." -- Heinrich Heine

item.title: Sally add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "The creatures that inhabit this earth--be they human beings or animals--are here to contribute, each in its own particular way, to the beauty and prosperity of the world." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Sally add a quote by Thich Nhat Hanh
item.description: "The kingdom of God is available to you in the here and the now. But the question is whether you are available to the kingdom. Our practice is to make ourselves ready for the kingdom so that it can manifest in the here and the now. You don't need to die in order to enter the kingdom of heaven. In fact, you have to be truly alive in order to do so." -- Thich Nhat Hanh

item.title: Sally add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "I don't know whether the universe, with its countless galaxies, stars and planets, has a deeper meaning or not, but at the very least, it is clear that we humans who live on this earth face the task of making a happy life for ourselves. Therefore, it is important to discover what will bring about the greatest degree of happiness." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Sally add a quote by Augustine of Hippo
item.description: "Hope has two beautiful daughters; their names are Anger and Courage. Anger at the way things are, and Courage to see that they do not remain as they are." -- Augustine of Hippo
